overview: From 2025-06-01 to 2025-06-08, elizaos/eliza had 40 new PRs (41 merged), 9 new issues, and 27 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Doesn't work this evm plugin -> @elizaos/plugin-evm
topIssues.author: 0xopsdev
topIssues.body:
I want to run evm ai agent with using plugin-evm
Inside characters/degen.character.json file I set evm plugins and modelprovider as openai.
Then set openai key to .env file
I also import plugin-coingecko, but it works with fetch token price or etc.
But If I want to swap tokens or transfer tokens, it doesn't work

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caece970-2e01-4591-858c-1ea8842bdfd0)

topIssues.title: I can't get my bot to detect my twitter activity
topIssues.author: FancyFishok
topIssues.body:
I got my bot to log in and make a post using the client on local host, but I can't get it to respond to other tweets using ‚ÄúTWITTER_TARGET‚Äù nor does it respond when I mention it with another account

I have already checked that my Cookies are ok and I've successfully installed the plugins

I also tried using Twitter-client in the plugins seccion

I am using the main version

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a82cafe-1acb-4f26-8991-aa67ec3d1dca)

topIssues.title: New plugin created from elizaos create -t plugin: remove requirements for Telegram, Discord configs
topIssues.author: techcomthanh
topIssues.body:
The newly created plugin, somehow when starting in /dev mode, it requires configurations for Telegram & Discords, even though I have never installed these plugins or asked the Agent to include them.

To reproduce:
elizaos create -t plugin name
cd plugin-name
elizaos dev (or start)

[2025-06-01 16:45:07] ERROR: Error details: Telegram configuration validation failed:
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN: Telegram bot token is required
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] ERROR: Stack trace: Error: Telegram configuration validation failed:
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN: Telegram bot token is required
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] WARN: Discord API Token not provided - Discord plugin is loaded but will not be functional
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] WARN: To enable Discord functionality, please provide DISCORD_API_TOKEN in your .eliza/.env file

Then process halted!

topIssues.title: X bot doesn't reply to any mentions at all
topIssues.author: Valcyclovir

topPRs.title: Move message server to self DB, add specs to core
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body: This PR updates the message server to use standalone and switches the core to use specs

topPRs.title: Add plugin specifications to core
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds plugin specifications to core

Everything should work as it has, and there should be no need to modify any code outside of core to engage this specification functionality.

In the future, plugins can be migrated to import the v2 specification from @elizaos/core/v2 and we will do our best to support forward compatibility with v3, v4, etc

topPRs.title: feat: refactor message server to be completely separate and standalone from agents
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR updates the message server to use standalone and switches the core to use specs

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Introduced a centralized messaging system with support for servers, channels (including group and DM), participants, and messages, enabling real-time chat and group conversations.
Added UI components for group channels, agent cards, group cards, and a group creation page.
Implemented file and media attachment support in chat and group conversations.
Enhanced sidebar and home page to display central servers and group channels.
Added offline status detection and improved connection handling.
Improvements

Refactored chat and group chat components to use centralized channels and messages.
Upgraded API client and hooks for new messaging, agent, and group management endpoints.
Improved optimistic UI updates and error handling for message sending and file uploads.
Enhanced agent and group navigation with direct message and group chat flows.
Bug Fixes

Improved error handling and logging for network and API failures.
Fixed message deduplication and sorting in chat views.
Documentation

Added detailed documentation for versioned plugin APIs and migration guides.
Tests

Added comprehensive unit and integration tests for new messaging, state conversion, provider compatibility, and search utilities.
Chores

Updated dependencies and improved internal type safety and code organization.

topPRs.title: feat: handleServerSync in an efficient way
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Introduce a new methods for creating a bunch of entities/rooms in a world in an efficient SQL manner

## What kind of change is this?

Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Because ai16z discord has 23k entities in it

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

completedItems.title: Fix/core build missing entry points
completedItems.body:
**Problem**

CLI plugin loading was failing with errors like export 'State' not found in './state' and export 'ActionExample' not found in './actionExample'. This prevented @elizaos/plugin-sql and other plugins from loading, causing the C

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged 3 PRs focused on bug fixes and optimizations, including fixing ElizaOS startup for plugins (#4873), resolving failing CLI CI test suites (#4870), and optimizing plugin loading to reduce startup log spam (#4868), with a total of +319/-848 lines changed. Also has an open PR for handling sidebar on mobile with Tailwind upgrades (#4866), and contributed to issue discussions with 4 comments across PRs and issues. Activity was concentrated on a single day this period, with work spanning feature development, bug fixes, and test improvements.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged 4 PRs this week, including enhancements to the core package build process (#4874, +60/-38 lines) and fixing linter formatting issues (#4878, +18/-14 lines). Contributed a total of +143/-94 lines across 21 files, with most work focused on configuration and code improvements, and approved 2 PRs from other contributors.

lalalune: Made substantial code changes across 474 files (+55,768/-25,067 lines) in 19 commits, with sporadic activity concentrated on a single day. Merged two small PRs: #4863 creating cursor rules (+228 lines) and #4862 adding an example of prompt injection (+7 lines), while also opening PR #4864 for a message server refactoring effort.

0xbbjoker: Opened a significant feature PR #4869 to replace PGLite message bus with a faster in-memory implementation, making substantial code changes (+1138/-674 lines across 18 files). Contributed to the project through 2 approving reviews and 1 PR comment on a single active day.

K1mc4n: Made a single documentation contribution by updating README_IND.md through PR #4867, adding 19 lines and removing 1 line of content. This was their only activity during the period, representing a focused but limited contribution to project documentation.
davidjsonn: Made a small documentation fix in PR #4875, correcting errors in CHANGELOG.md with 2 lines added and 2 removed.
github-advanced-security: Minimal activity this week with only one review comment provided. No PRs were opened or merged, no issues were created or commented on, and no code changes were made.
techcomthanh: Opened issue #4872 regarding removing requirements from plugin templates created with the elizaos tool. No other activity this week.
ceeriil: Opened issue #4876 regarding fallback mechanisms for package installation when Bun fails on macOS.
BinaryBluePeach: Opened issue #4861 regarding plugin installation problems with the giphy plugin. No other activity this period.
